title: A song sung by Mrs. Aliff in the play call'd Tyrannick love, or, The royal martyre set by Mr. Henry Purceell [sic]
author: Purcell, Henry, 1659-1695.
notes: Erroneously attributed by Wing to D'Urfey; actually based on the play by John Dryden.
First staff reads: Ah! how sweet, ah, how sweet, how sweet it is to love.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
